title.narrative: 5.1 ACCESS AND EQUITY

description.narrative: 5.1 Improved equitable access to and retention of children (boys and girls) in basic education in Sierra Leone, with a focus on vulnerable groups by the end of December 2019., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5.0 Improved learning outcomes and equitable and inclusive education for all boys and girls by 2018

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.1 Improved equitable access to and retention of children (boys and girls) in basic education in Sierra Leone, with a focus onvulnerable groups by the end of December 2019.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Basic and Senior Secondary Education (MBSSE) helped to ensure access to school for close to 99,000 vulnerable children in hard-to-reach communities, improving equitable access to education in Sierra Leone. Additionally, 127 education stakeholders participated in training to address negative social norms which hinder children's access to education. To promote girls' attendance and retention, 397 school and community stakeholders were trained on Menstrual Hygiene Management (MHM) and 15,000 reusable menstrual hygiene kits distributed in 82 schools to 15,000 girls. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
